intro: Lotononis platycarpa var. abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian lotononis, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It features erect stems with opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its propagation in its native habitat.
